title: American soccer star Christian Pulisic scores first-ever Premier League goals
text:
CLOSE

U.S. men's national soccer team winger Christian Pulisic joined Chelsea's starting lineup Saturday at Burnley and made the most of it, scoring his first Premier League goal 20 minutes in and then scoring two more to record a hat trick in Chelsea's 4-2 win.

Chants for Pulisic and "USA" roared throughout the crowd. Pulisic became the first American to score more than two goals in a single game in the Premier League since Clint Dempsey had a hat trick in 2012 for Fulham against Newcastle.

The first two goals were impressive solo scores. For the first goal, Pulisic put the ball to the back post off a shifty move and left-footed kick to become the 22nd American to score a goal in the Premier League.

After scoring Pulisic erupted in emotion, capturing the meaning of his first score.

On the second goal shortly before the half, he pulled away from defenders and found the net with a right-footed kick.

On the third, Pulisic scored off a header in the second half to record the hat trick.

PULISIC HATTRICK AHHHHH pic.twitter.com/UPNktW4pBp — NBC Sports Soccer (@NBCSportsSoccer) October 26, 2019

Pulisic became the fourth player 21 years of age or younger to score a perfect hat trick in the Premier League, according to ESPN Stats & Info.

Pulisic played strong as a substitute in Chelsea's Champions League win at Ajax earlier this week, helping the 21-year-old up-and-comer earn the start Saturday where he replaced Callum Hudson-Odoi.

Chelsea manager Frank Lampard told reporters Friday: "The way he's played, he deserves a starting place regularly in the last few weeks, but so do others and that's what I keep saying is the nice problem that I have. But it's brilliant that he's coming on and making the impact that he's making and of course he'll get his starts, that's the reason he's come here."
